resources.string: (1) Better knowledge and understanding of scripture. (2) Personal enrichment and guidance from God. (3) Potentially increased faith. (4) Improved ability to overcome temptations. (5) Greater ability to serve by teaching, counseling, refuting error, exhorting, etc.
Here are a few of God\'s promises associated with memorization/meditation:

Joshua 1:8 This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth; but thou shalt meditate therein day and night, that thou mayest observe to do according to all that is written therein: for then thou shalt make thy way prosperous, and then thou shalt have good success.

Psalm 1:2-3 But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night. And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.

John 15:7 If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.\nEphesians 6:11
